{{cpp/chrono/duration/title|zero}}
{{cpp/chrono/duration/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++20|dcl1=
static constexpr duration zero();
|dcl2=
static constexpr duration zero() noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a zero-length duration.

If the representation {{tt|rep}} of the duration requires some other implementation to return a zero-length duration, {{lc|std::chrono::duration_values}} can be specialized to return the desired value.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
Returns {{c|duration(std::chrono::duration_values&lt;rep&gt;::zero())}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;ratio&gt;

template&lt;typename X, typename Y&gt;
using dura = std::chrono::duration&lt;X, Y&gt;;

static_assert
(
    (std::chrono::hours::zero() == std::chrono::nanoseconds::zero()) &amp;&amp;
    (dura&lt;short, std::nano&gt;::zero() == dura&lt;int, std::deci&gt;::zero()) &amp;&amp;
    (dura&lt;short, std::deca&gt;::zero() == dura&lt;long, std::exa&gt;::zero()) &amp;&amp;
    (dura&lt;long, std::atto&gt;::zero().count() == dura&lt;float, std::exa&gt;::zero().count())
);

int main() {}
}}
